attributes.comment:
It won't be so bad paying the fee increase if there is a subsequent and
proportional improvement with field office service. It is sad to know that service
at the moment can be much better if only the people at the desks are more willing
to be efficient and effective. At the Detroit field office, you would see 2-3
customer representatives talking and obviously not attending to anyone and yet,
they would look disgustedly at the long line forming or at the rapidly growing
crowd in the lobby and yet, not call the next client until after a good 20 minutes
of no-nonsense I'm-not-doing-anything-right-now-but-I-will-everyone-wait-
anyway attitude. Now, tell me how I can feel that hiking up the fees will improve
the service of people like these?! Had I seen an improvement in the past 10
years, I would not mind so much but, things are worse, your representatives are
more abrupt and rude, and some are just plain nasty...and you expect me to just
sit back and pay you more for a lousy service?!
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Ma Donna Gepilano
